This sweet

properties.name: Arlington National Cemetery
properties.description: Posted by Ionicjames214 McNair Rd,VirginiaArlington National Cemetery is a that began in the Civil War. During the war, the hospitals and burial grounds began to overflow. It was proposed to Robert E. Lee\'s family to use some of the acres for burials. Since that time, more than 245,000 soldiers have been buried over 624 acres. Veterans from every war have since been buried there. The Tomb of the Unknowns is also known as the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier. It stands at the top of the hill. It was open to the public in 1932 and cost 8,000.

properties.name: Big Ben
properties.description: Posted by IonicjamesLondon,EnglandThe Clock Tower is about 200 ft tall. The Tower is rested on a concrete Block that starts at the towers base and goes 23 ft below the ground. Over the years it has started to lean about 8in. to the west.

properties.name: Eifflel Tower
properties.description: Posted by Ionicjamesparis,franceThe Eiffel Tower is the biggest building in all of France. More than 200,000,000 have visited the Eiffel tower since it was built in 1889. This building weighs 7,300 pounds. There is access to the first and second floors. There is a ticket booth at the bottom. So you have to pay to get the stairs.

properties.name: GoldenGate Bridge
properties.description: Posted by IonicjamesSan FrinciscoThe Length of the Bridge is about 9,00ft tall. There is a Toll to get across and it is .00. First opened at May,27,1937. It is also 90ft wide.

properties.name: Huntington Lake
properties.description: Posted by IonicjamesCalifornia Huntington Lake is below the alpine level at 7,000 feet in the High Sierras. San Joaquin Valley is located there it is one of the favorite places for people that go there.

properties.name: Liberty Bell
properties.description: Posted by IonicjamesMarket Street,Pennsylvania

properties.name: Lincoln Memorial
properties.description: Posted by IonicjamesWest Potomac Park, MarylandThe Lincoln Memorial is a monument for our 16th President. The statue of Abraham Lincoln is 19 ft. tall but the original plans were to only make it 10 ft. tall. The reason why they changed the plans was to make sure Lincoln was not too small for the rest of the building. The monument is surrounded by 38 columns; 36 representing the 36 states in the union at the time of his death and 2 columns in the entrance. The memorial is visited by millions of tourists each year and is also a place for public gatherings. Martin Luther King even gave his "I have a dream" speech.

properties.name: Supreme Court Building
properties.description: Posted by IonicjamesFirst and Capitol Streets, NE, Washington, DCThe Supreme Court building rises 92 ft. above ground. Construction began in 1932 and was completed in 1935.It was designed to represent the importance of the court. Construction cost ,740,000. It was under budget by 4,000. The public front is made up of many different types of marble from several different states. The west side of the building reads "Equal Justice Under Law" and the east side reads "Justice, The Guardian of Liberty". This building has several different floors from the basement all the way to the 4th floor that has a basketball court.

properties.name: The White House
properties.description: Posted by IonicjamesWashington DC,MarylandThe White House is where the president lives. It is all white as you can tell and Helicopters pick and drop off the president in the backyard when he needs to get somewhere.

properties.name: USS Arizona Memorial
properties.description: Posted by IonicjamesPearl Harbor, HawaiiThe USS Arizona Memorial is in Pearl Harbor, Hawaii. Many sailors were killed in the attack at Pearl Harbor. The memorial represents the 1,177 sailors killed. The memorial actually goes right over the sunken hull of the ship. It was dedicated in 1962. It is now a visitor center connected with the memorial. Visitors can receive information on the war as well as see a list of the sailor\'s names on on the northwestern wall. There is 3 main parts to the memorial; entry, assembly room & shrine. Assembly room has 21 windows for 21 gun salute or 21 Marines standing at the tomb of the fallen. There is an open floor where you can see the oil-seeping wreck. The oil is sometimes referred to as black tears.
